ok. # this text was pretty interesting, actually.

I'm sure it will be. # Again, remember that in order to elaborate, we have to go outside of what the writer has written. # We have to make connections in the text that are not explicitly given. # Let's get started. # read this text, when you are finished reading, click the continue button at the bottom of the page.
that wraps up our discussion for today. # I hope you enjoyed learning about elaborating on persuasive texts!
I know I did. # These passages were really interesting, and I think I understand some of the material better as well.
Jordan, that's great! # I hope to see you both again soon! # Bye!
_user_ and Jordan, hello. # Welcome back! # Today we will be learning how to elaborate on persuasive texts.
The writers of persuasive texts are trying to convince us of something, right?

Jordan, that's right! # They support their position using arguments and supportive information. # Remember, elaborating on a text means that we are asking questions and making inferences. # Inferences are based, on the text, but they are not found directly in the text.
Oh yes, I remember this from last time. # Can you give me an example of how a writer would do this in a persuasive text?

You got it. # Look at the text below that is taken from a text message on a cell phone. # In this case, you can see that the writer is very upset because they are at a movie theater and everyone around them is using a phone. # They have even complained to the theater manager.
Ok, I think I get it. # So, even though they do not specifically say it, we can infer that they believe that phones should not be allowed in movie theaters.
Exactly! # Now, I have picked out a few persuasive texts so you can practice elaborating on your own.
_user_, lets both read the text on our own. # When you are finished reading, click on the button at the bottom that says click to continue and then we can start trying to elaborate!
